questions.text: Which of the following is correct about Na-K ATP ase pump?

choices.text: Alpha subunit has 5 binding sites and beta subunit has 3 extracellular glycosylation sites
Alpha subunit has 2 binding sites and beta subunit has 3 binding sites
Alpha subunit has 3 binding sites and alpha subunit has 2 binding sites

questions.text: Which is correct if plasma glucose rises beyond TMG value mentioned in graph for glucose excretion?

choices.text: Increase reabsorption in parallel with filtered load
Increase excreted rate in parallel with filtered load
Decrease reabsorption in parallel with filtered load
Decrease excreted rate in parallel with filtered load

questions.text: A child from slums went for open air defecation and was attacked by a pack of stray dogs. He subsequently developed rabies. The rabies will attack the nervous system using __________ in the axonal transport system?
The Hamburger phenomenon refers to?

choices.text: Exchange of HCO₃⁻ into RBCs for Cl⁻ out of RBCs in venous blood
Exchange of Cl⁻ into RBCs for HCO₃⁻ out of RBCs in venous blood
Exchange of HCO₃⁻ into RBCs for Cl⁻ out of RBCs in arterial blood
Exchange of Cl⁻ into RBCs for HCO₃⁻ out of RBCs in arterial blood

A 30-year-old man falls asleep after heavy alcohol intake with his arm draped over a chair. The next morning, he develops weakness of wrist extension with wrist drop. Examination reveals intact triceps strength but weakness of extensors of the wrist and fingers. Nerve conduction studies show a transient conduction block at the spiral groove of the humerus.Which of the following best describes the structural status of the nerve in this condition?

choices.text: Both axon and endoneurium are disrupted
Axon is disrupted but endoneurium is intact
Complete disruption of nerve including endoneurium and perineurium

questions.text: All of the following increase the activity of Na-K pump except?

choices.text: Bradycardia , apnea and increased vascular resistance
Tachycardia, apnea and increased vascular resistance
Bradycardia , apnea and decreased vascular resistance
Tachycardia, apnea and decreased vascular resistance

A 24-year-old male presents with rapidly progressive flaccid paralysis, areflexia, and impaired vibration and position sense. LP report shows cyto-albuminological dissociation. He is diagnosed with Acute Inflammatory demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy. Which of the following nerve fiber types are predominantly affected in this condition?

A 55-year-old man with a 10-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus presents with burning pain sensation in both feet and occasional dizziness while standing. On examination, he has features of autonomic dysfunction like postural hypotension and lack of sweating in feet. Which of the following nerve fibers are predominantly affected in this patient’s condition?
DLCO is increased in which of the following conditions

Mark the Functional residual capacity?

A 22-year-old man sustains a clean-cut injury to the ulnar nerve at the wrist. After the injury, the part of the axon separated from the cell body undergoes fragmentation of axons and myelin within a few days, accompanied by infiltration of macrophages and proliferation of Schwann cells. Which of the following best describes this process?
Which of the following is responsible for clearance of surfactant in the lungs?

A 10-year-old child is having Gower sign and Pseudohypertrophy of calf muscles. He is diagnosed as having a deficiency of dystrophin protein in skeletal muscles. Which of the following best describes dystrophin?
Which is correct about electromechanical systole?

choices.text: Onset of qRS complex to closure of aortic valve
Onset of qRS to end of T wave
Onset of qRS to closure of mitral valve
Onset of qRS to start of T wave

Eyes move right in response to turning head to right side and same for other eye
